title: The Morning Rush
prompt: You wake up late for work. The clock says 8:45 AM, and your meeting starts at 9. What do you do?

choices.text: Arrive late with coffee and confidently say: 'Good things take time!'
Call HR to request a half-day off, claiming self-care.
Skip breakfast, grab your laptop, and rush to work like a tornado.
Email your boss: 'Stuck in traffic, I’ll join remotely!' Then have a leisurely breakfast.

title: The Forgotten Birthday
prompt: Your best friend reminds you it’s their birthday, and you completely forgot to get them a gift. What’s your move?

choices.text: Show up with nothing but a big smile and say: 'Memories are priceless, right?'
Apologize profusely and promise to plan something special next weekend.
Quickly order something online and say: 'It’s on its way—just like good surprises!'
Tell your friend: 'I thought we were past material stuff—our friendship is the real gift.'

title: The Spicy Office Email
prompt: You accidentally hit 'Reply All' on an email meant for a close colleague, and now the whole office knows your thoughts about Karen’s cooking at the potluck. What do you do?

choices.text: Send a follow-up email clarifying it was a joke.
Own it and say: 'Honesty is the best policy, folks!'
Say nothing and pretend it never happened.
Apologize directly to Karen in person and offer to bring cookies to the next potluck.

title: The Traffic Jam
prompt: You’re stuck in a bumper-to-bumper traffic jam, and your phone battery is at 2%. What do you do?

choices.text: Use your last 2% of battery to call someone you enjoy talking to.
Honk and complain loudly to yourself.
Get out of the car and start chatting with other drivers.
Turn on some calming music and wait it out.

title: The Missing Socks
prompt: You’re getting ready for a date, but you can’t find a matching pair of socks. The clock is ticking. What do you do?

choices.text: Tear apart your room in a desperate search.
Go sockless and rock a quirky, carefree vibe.
Wear mismatched socks with confidence.
Text your date jokingly: 'My socks are protesting—running a little late!'

prompt: You’re at a coffee shop, and the barista messes up your complicated order. They look swamped. What do you do?

choices.text: Drink the wrong coffee and convince yourself it’s fine.
Politely ask for a remake, but feel guilty about adding to their workload.
Hand them a tip and joke: 'Next time, surprise me with your masterpiece!'
Take a sip, smile, and say: 'This is great! You’ve invented a new favorite for me.'

prompt: You’re in a group project, and one team member isn’t pulling their weight. The deadline is tomorrow. What’s your move?

choices.text: Submit the work as-is and say: 'Sometimes less is more, right?'
Call them out in the group chat, hoping they step up.
Rally the group with: 'Let’s finish this together—we’ve got this!'
Cover their tasks yourself, then jokingly ask for extra credit.

prompt: You order a trendy jacket online, but it arrives two sizes too small. You needed it for an event tomorrow. What do you do?

choices.text: Post online: 'Who needs jackets anyway? Staying cool is the real trend.'
Wear something else and return the jacket later.
Try squeezing into it and pray no one notices.
Layer it as an accessory and say: 'It’s a fashion statement!'

prompt: You’re at the gym, and you accidentally drop your water bottle during a yoga class. It rolls across the floor, interrupting everyone. What do you do?

choices.text: Turn it into a zen moment: 'The bottle has found its own flow—like we should!'
Laugh and say: 'Guess my bottle needed a workout too!'
Wait until the session ends, then quietly retrieve it.
Apologize profusely and scramble to pick it up.

prompt: Your neighbor knocks on your door, complaining about noise from your weekend party. What do you do?

choices.text: Say: 'Thanks for letting me know—good neighbors keep it real!'
Apologize sincerely and promise to keep it down next time.
Invite them to join the next party as a peace offering.
Joke: 'Well, at least now you know our playlist is awesome!'
